answers.answer: It is unlikely that the radioactive iodine scan next week will help solve this.You did not mention whether or not yet thyroid nodules.  It sounds like you've had negative thyroid antibodies, suggesting against autoimmune thyroid disease.  There is no set size for surgery for the thyroid.  There are times where other adjacent structures in the neck may swell such as the throat or esophagus and make it feel like the thyroid is swollen.  These can be difficult cases.  I have had some success with empiric antacids treatment as sometimes this can be a symptom of acid reflux.  I think looking at the ultrasound gives us the best insight into the possibility of structural thyroid abnormalities.  This is best done by a thyroid expert who does his/her own ultrasound in the office.
